result.execSummary:
The defendant Neil A Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must comply with all child support orders. Must not associate with any known users of illegal substances with the exception of in the counseling environment.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: Immediately upon release defendant must report to Harvest or a similar treatment facility.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Neil A Schwartz in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Neil A Schwartz in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for Gerad Dougvillo for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Mr. Dougvillo appears for the State. Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions or corretions noted by parties. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950.

BTC: Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES - STAYED. 4 yrs probation.

Conditions:
120 days RCJ/CFTS. Immediately upon release, deft must report to Harvest or a similar facility
obey all rules and regs

Ct 1: 943.10(1m)(a)-Burglary-Building or Dwelling.  No contact with the victim, DAD (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 08-04-2015 - SCRAM/GPS MAY BE REMOVED. DEFENDANT MAY HAVE NON-VIOLENT TELEPHONE CONTACT WITH VICTIM

Defendant Neil A Schwartz in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for Gerad Dougvillo for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Defense indicates that the defendant has a prescription here but Mr. Cruz is not able to document that it is in fact a prescription from the treatment facility. The State asks that the defendant be remanded into custody and that the bond be increased.

BTC: **DEFENDANT IS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY** Bond is to be modified to $5,000.00 cash. All terms and conditions remain as previously ordered
Status conference at 11-06-2015 04:00 pm

Defendant Neil A Schwartz in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense tested dirty 11/2. The State asks that the bond be converted to cash and deft taken into custody. Defense indicates that deft has a prescription for the medication deft has tested positive for.

BTC:  Decision to be deferred to this afternoon. There must be proof deft was prescribed suboxone and it was given to him prior to 11/2/15 and in what quantities deft was taking it. The State is to contact to ZCI to quantify the type of opiate used.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
from ZCI - Incident Report
Status conference at 11-06-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Neil A Schwartz in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State has filed a motion to modify bond due to deft's non compliance with ZCI. The State indicates that he has spoken with Mr. Cruz and defense indicates he did report to ZCI. The State asks that the Court order deft go to ZCI immediately after court and that the deft come back this afternoon or later this week.

BTC: Deft to go to ZCI immediately after court and return later this week  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
ZCI

for expedited bail bond hearing at the request of the State

Defendant Neil A Schwartz in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt/waives reading of same; NG plea entered.
Upon plea to charge in amended information, the State recommends 24 mos IC, 36 mos ES - STAYED. probation; 120 days RCJ and other approp conditions.

Defendant Neil A Schwartz in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Neil A Schwartz in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
Defense is asking deft be released on signature or co-signature bond with Katie Brown, 9-19-1992.  Defense indicates defendant has no objection to GPS. The court conducts colloquy with proposed co-signer. The State does not believe a signature bond is appropriate due to the charges deft places. The State does not believe a signature bond or a co-signature bond would be enough to secure the defendant's appearance in court and is concerned with the ability of the proposed co-signer to secure the funds should they be forfeited. The State does not object to a modification of the cash but the State believes cash is appropriate.

BTC: Bond may be modified to $3000.00 co-signature bond with Katie Brown 09-19-1992. GPS/house arrest. Exceptions are for treament, attorney visits and court. all other terms and conditions remain
